medical_history.chief_complaint: Erythrocytosis during testosterone treatment and SGLT2 inhibitor therapy in a patient with hypogonadism and type 2 diabetes mellitus
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient started testosterone replacement therapy 7 months prior to presentation. Three months after initiating SGLT2i, the patient experienced a significant increase in hematocrit, hemoglobin, and red blood cell count, although he lost 7.5 kg and achieved good glycemic control.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 10-year history of type 2 diabetes mellitus treated with metformin, glimepiride, and exenatide. Also has a history of class I obesity, uncomplicated arterial hypertension, and hypercholesterolemia treated with amlodipine, telmisartan, hydrochlorothiazide, and simvastatin. Underwent unilateral orchiectomy for cryptorchidism at age 16.
